Very, very clean room, bathroom and carpets. Rooms appear to have been remodeled recently - and not one of those cheap, slap-dash remodeling jobs (no neglected corners or make-shift repairs). In-closet safe, iron and ironing board, flat screen TV and coffee maker. Beds were comfortable and spotlessly clean, but not luxurious (very much like what we have at home!). Services were basic - no breakfast, $10 daily for internet, minimal TV stations, no fridge and "room service" is really a call for take-out delivery - but given cleanliness, price and location at epicenter of downtown (above plus pleasant walk through Chinatown to North Beach or to the Embarcadero) this hotel simply cannot be topped.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: RSW82
Reviews.Content: this was a great hotel for the cost. The location is great and we walked everywhere. It is incredibly clean and yes, the towel animals are amazing. It is fantastic value for money with lovely services. Would stay there again and recommend! for a couple the room was ample size, comfy bed, lovely en suite bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Convenient, and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: ZellV
Reviews.Content: I'd recommend it if you're looking for a no-frills, clean, convenient place on a budget, especially if you're traveling alone like me. I went in early May and booked online in advance, so I got a rate of about $100/night, which is pretty good considering it's right in downtown SF. The trains and cable cars are a few minutes' walk away. It's right between Union Square and Chinatown so you can do your shopping and hunt down some cheap and good grub in one trip (try looking on Stockton St., one block west). The staff is polite and helpful. The TV reception wasn't great, but who spends their vacation cooped up in front of the TV anyway? Grant St. is not very busy at night so things do quiet down then. You may still hear some ambient noise outside but you could try asking for a room toward the back if that's a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, amazing hotel”
Reviews.Author: misablue
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed in this lovely clean hotel for 4 nights in May. Hotel is in best location possible, right by gate to Chinatown and all great restaurants, and less than 5 minute walk to Union Square and Market street. Everyday we kept saying how glad we are that we chose hotel in this location! Our room was on 4th floor facing the Grant Avenue, room was clean, spacious double with clean bathroom. There was also big cupboard for clothes, suitcases and with safe. Reception staff always happy to help. Exceeded all our expectations. Amazing, would come back any time, great value for money! Better than some 3 star hotels we stayed in. There are coffee& tea facilities on the ground floor by reception. For breakfast we went to TacoBel on Market street, cheap breakfast buritos :-) Only one minus is Wi-Fi charge of $9 per day, but there is Starbucks couple houses up, so went there to check our emails etc. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “A Great location and a nice place to stay in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: jhnh
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent 5 nights at the Baldwin Hotel (May 4th to 9th). The location was perfect and the staff were very polite and helpful. For a two star hotel it was more than we expected. The room price was very affordable for an such expensive city. The hotel is located close to the gates of China Town. There are plenty of good restaurants in the area. We loved having a Starbucks just up the street. The French restaurant on the corner was perfect for a delicious breakfast or dinner. Union Square was very close by and lots of fun to explore and shop around. We used the Montgomery station and BART for our airport transportation. The station is only a 10 minute walk from the hotel. With affordable City Passes, we took advantage of bus, streetcar, cable car and lightrail stops all within walking distance of the Baldwin. Our hotel room was on the third floor and overlooked Grant Avenue. We had a very comfortable double bed. The room was spacious enough and was very clean. The window opened for fresh air and there was a ceiling fan for good air circulation. The washroom was clean and small but adequate with a tub. The room included a flat screen tv with a free movie channel. The cleaning staff did a great job and we loved the towel art sculptures left on the bed each day. The only challege we had was getting use to the noise of the big city at night but after a couple of nights we seemed to adjust. We appreciated staff assistance with directions, tourist info and printing of boarding passes for our flights on the last day. Next time we are in San Francisco, the Baldwin Hotel will be our choice.

Reviews.Title: “What a gem!!”
Reviews.Author: ChrissyPortmacquarie
Reviews.Content: WE stayed at the Baldwin for 3 nights. The location is fantastic and the rooms were lovely and well renovated. It is very economical to stay here...rooms under $80 at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Poochifur
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights early April based on reviews. This hotel cannot be beaten on value for money due to it's location. Right next to Chinatown, 20 min walk to the bay, 5 min walk to shops and transport links. Reception were helpful and housekeeping good. The only think that let it down was the basic room. So basic in fact that we weren't able to turn off the heating as apparently it's on a system and as it was 70 degrees during our stay it meant we had to keep the window open = noisy, uncomfortable and not much sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: daz2397
Reviews.Content: Great location near UNION SQUARE and just across the road from the CHINATOWN sign. Fishermans wharf only about two miles away, with stunning views. Cycle from pier 41 over the Golden Gate bridge to Sausilito and get ferry back, a bit pricey but good experience. Good irish bar callled the irish bank less then 100 yards from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money in downtown San francisco”
Reviews.Author: paul611
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights. Decided on hotel after reading TA reviews. I certainly wasn't disappointed. Location is everything. A short walk takes you to the cable car and busses / streetcars around Union Square. Room was comfortable and clean. Only downside for me was the noise of the lift and the inevitable street noise, but on balance a good choice for a first time visit.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location....”
Reviews.Author: Marcus_CAN
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, very close to Chinatown and Union Sq. Friendly and helpful staff. Rooms are small but clean. I read some previous reviews but I did not experiecnce any problems. I would recommend this hotel for people on budget and who don't need any special luxuries. No free internet ($9 per day) but go to Starbucks and you'll get one free.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: seacat123
Reviews.Content: The check in at the Baldwin hotel was smooth, Reception staff very helpful with their knowledge of area and events. Rooms comfy and the bath nice but shower pressure just ok. Maid service is very good. The area is excellent and at the gate of Chinatown. Plenty of shops in the area and they have coffee available 24 hours in the lobby. Overall I would recommend to hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ok value for money”
Reviews.Author: LittleSnuffy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. The location was good, close to Chinatown. The rooms were small and stuffy and the linen was itchy but they were clean. Overall it was fairly good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Price for Location”
Reviews.Author: cespedes85
Reviews.Content: Pro: Located right beside the Gates of China Town. & a Great French Breakfast place in the corner. Great Room Service, Clean, Quiet, and tour sightseeing buses have a spot right in front of the gates so you don't have to walk far. Con: Wouldn't say anything, I went with my brother to run a marathon and found this a great place for family. also the decor is a little on the old side but really clean.

Reviews.Title: “We had a blast in San Francisco and the Baldwin was the perfect place to stay for our needs.”
Reviews.Author: tddoyle4
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin was affordable, clean, comfortable and friendly. It's location between Chinatown and Union Square and close to Cable Car lines made it the perfect place to venture out each morning to where ever we wanted to go. It was also very easy to come back to the hotel in between excursions to change, rest, etc. Good places to eat within a very short distance, Chinatown a brief walk away - it was really a terrific stay in San Francisco and we were so pleased with our choice of the Baldwin Hotel! One small suggestion - don't make the lobby coffee so darn strong!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, rooms and value”
Reviews.Author: mulder2112
Reviews.Content: Good sized room, with plenty storage. Clean and in a great location, I had no problems with the hotel at all for the nights I was there. Good value, and although a little basic in places, was ideal for a comfortable and peaceful base. Wifi was fine, although not free. Plenty places to eat nearby. Friendly front desk staff. Would be happy to return next time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, Comfortable and Cost Effective”
Reviews.Author: suitscase
Reviews.Content: This year we enjoyed a spring break time away in California. Had wanted to visit San Francisco for some time and the Jackson Browne Concert in Santa Cruz gave us the excuse to see this part of North America. We found the Baldwin using trip advisor and when we called to book the rooms found out they were offering a fantastic low-season rate on the rooms. Yes the previous reviews were right â€“ it is a noisy place being right in the middle of Union Square and steps from the Chinatown Gate. Since it is a 100 year old Californian building the windows and only single pane glass and do not block out much sound. As well we were in room 901 and I think all the 01 rooms are right by the elevator shaft. It is an old elevator and the cables rattle which is heard in the room. But as I have mentioned in other reviews â€“ I travel with ear plugs to help me sleep and the man who sleeps beside me could nap through Dim Sum so we were fine. I think the rooms at the back of the hotel are quieter. The room was an adequate size, but really we do not spend a lot of time in the rooms when we travel. Bed nice and comfortable, new flat screen TV to watch if you want to spend travel time watching tv ;-) Only thing the room was missing was a second chair which would have been useful when we brought â€œhomeâ€� the pizza to eat in the room! Staff were helpful, great restaurant recommendations and Uncle Vitoâ€™s Pizza just south of the hotel is worth a visit. We enjoyed the coffee and hot water for tea that was in the small sitting area just off the lobby. Only basic black tea so if you like some herbal tea before bed bring your own teabags! A good idea to bring your own mug too since all they have is Styrofoam cups. The WiFi was a horrid price at $9 a day. I just wandered down to the green and white Seattle based Coffee monopoly and bought some tea and used their internet each evening (being cheap, and inventive I saved the mug for the morning coffee . . . hate Styrofoam!) The location is one of the best parts of this hotel. You are a few blocks from the BART so can just take the train in from the airport. And you are a short 3-4 block walk to the main bus routes, trams, cable cars, and walking distance to the waterfront. Wear comfortable shoes and donâ€™t bother renting a car â€“ no where to park it anyhow!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location”
Reviews.Author: AlisonandBill
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our stay at the Baldwin. The staff were friendly and helpful which is very helpful in a city that you don't know. The location was great, right near all public transfer, close to excellent restaurants, even close to a laundry mat. Our room was very clean when we arrived and stayed that way during our whole stay. I don't have a negative thing to say about this hotel. AT less than $100 a night I would recmmend this hotel to everyone

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, central location, walking distance to everything”
Reviews.Author: yo_yao_11_ming
Reviews.Content: Nice hosts, hassle free check in. Spacious room (for 1), clean bathroom, secure and safe Excellent location, 20 minutes to the chinatown gate!, short distance to trams to take you everywhere else Best - No problems at all with the hotel or staff!! Worst - being from Australia, not used to the constant sound of sirens at night (is that a san fran thing?) In summary, i would highly recomment this hotel to fellow travellers

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, very reasonable hotel.”
Reviews.Author: smithdat
Reviews.Content: This hotel didn't have all the bells and whistles of the Hilton, Omni, or Westin hotels, but it got the job done. Nice clean rooms, soft comfortable beds, and incredibly reasonable prices and friendly staff. My only gripe was with the television service, it was just not very good reception. Oh and the bathroom fan was loud. Other than those two things, it was pretty close to perfect. I will be staying there again when I visit the Bay area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Teacherbear
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ver well located and offers great value for the money. The rooms are small but functional. The tv is no wide screen but ok. The room we had , had a very large closet which wass super everything could be put in it. The bathroom was good. The elevator is a bit slow. Check in staff were super and very helpful in all regards. There is. O breakfaast jsut coffee

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in beautiful San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: jk121255
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at the Baldwin Hotel after seeing the overwhelming good recommendations from other TripAdvisor users. The hotel completely lived up to my expectations! Its in a fantastic location - it's a short walk from China Town, the Montgomery BART station (which goes to SFO airport), Union Square (for shopping). It's also in one of the nicer areas of town -there are some pretty sketchy neighborhoods, stay away from Tenderloin at night. San Francisco has a world class public transport network so you'll be able to get to Fisherman's Wharf, Pier 39, The Golden Gate Bridge and Park really easily. The room we stayed in was a decent size and was spotless and serviced very well by housekeeping. We paid a very good rate for the Baldwin Hotel which was money well spent for such a nice place. There's a laundromat around the corner and the only negative I have to say about the hotel is the lack of free wifi. But there is a Starbucks a few doors down so you can check your email over coffee ;) I would definitely recommend it to every kind of traveler and would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: likestotravePatty
Reviews.Content: I would definately recommend this hotel. Have been visiting for many years on day trips, but treated three 18 year old girls for their Birthday so we spend the weekend. Plenty of room for all of us. The lobby and rooms were nice and clean especially the bathroom which had plenty of nice towels. Comfortable bed and great pillows. Hotel staff very friendly! Parking was not bad for the price which you have to pay for anyway when staying for the day. Great Place overall and for breakfast on the cheap there is a Starbucks next door and Subway 1/2 block. China Gate is right there, Union Square 2 blocks away along w/the cable cars. Overall very nice updated condition for an older hotel in a big city. I am looking forward for another stay here in the future

Reviews.Title: “My default San Francisco hotel for my next trip!”
Reviews.Author: soochie
Reviews.Content: Firstly, talk about nearby amenities around the hotel walking distance to BART (Although I ride once) walking distance to Sear's Diners! and Chinatown! walking distance to Union Square! walking distance to the garage where I parked my car! walking distance to a mini mart (turn left after starbucks)! Secondly, talk about the hotel itself accommodating and friendly staff! ask them questions, they will glady help. safe vicinity, no beggars, no dirty places or clubs quiet area/street, I do not know why some reviews mentioned noisy street. clean room, no bugs no smell!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: Angel250580
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located. We had a room on the 6th floor that was clean and quiet. The organization of the room was strange, the TV was not in front of the bed. The personnel is ok. Overall the price is really good and the quality as well. No breakfast available.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for downtown San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: abulon
Reviews.Content: Very clean comfortable sixth floor room, quiet even though the windows overlooked Grant Street. Helpful staff. Secure access with a front door key required at night. Will certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and value”
Reviews.Author: Steve631
Reviews.Content: It was only $70 per night for a single room with queen bed since I booked a few months in advance. Although it's a basic hotel, the location is right outside the main gate to Chinatown and there are lots of places to eat and shop in the immediate area. The maid service and reception were also very good. 10-15 minute walk from the Moscone Center.

Reviews.Title: “Not spectacular but a great deal in an expensive city”
Reviews.Author: acerussi
Reviews.Content: I plan to return to this hotel - very good deal in SF. Not far from BART station (5 min walk) or the monscone convention center (10 minute walk). The single rooms are small and the bathroom smaller. no frills here - just the basics. And someone on the cleaning crew did manage to leave towels shaped as animals - sort of origami - and it was delightful. front office was helpful. high-speed wireless internet available for a reasonable fee. I might not recommend the place for families unless you get multiple rooms, but if you are a single business traveler you might be hard pressed to find a better deal in SF.

Reviews.Title: “Great location at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: PickyTraveler43
Reviews.Content: Great location at a great price! Close enough to walk to lots of placesand close to transit lines. It is noisy, but that's to be expected in the middle of a densely packed city. Rooms are clean, bathrooms sparkle. We've stayed at the Baldwin three times. The room is basic and our TV had a buzzing noise, but if you're out and about enjoying San Francisco, those are very minor issues. There's a Starbucks almost next door.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in San Francisco!”
Reviews.Author: mainegeographer
Reviews.Content: This place is a real 'steal' - can't be beat for the price. I was here in Jan. 11 and paid only $59.50/night for a clean, comfortable room with excellent service. The rooms are on the small side, but not at all tight, and ours had a large walk-in closet. The staff really does a nice job of creating a nice atmosphere in the hotel and the rooms themselves. Most ideal about this place is its location. It is within blocks of Union Square and Market Street shops and restaurants, very close to the cable car ride to Fisherman's Wharf or Alcatraz, and right at the entrance gate of Chinatown! A wonderful place and terrific value!

Reviews.Title: “Would Stay Again”
Reviews.Author: coconewbie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is steps to China Town and the great shopping in Union Square. If you are a walker, like myself, it was close enough to North Beach, Little Italy, The Bart, The Muni, and of coarse the Starbucks located two doors down. The customer service was superb, rooms were cozy, cute and comfortable. They do not offer room service but they do provide a menu to have food delivered so thats nice.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect find for us”
Reviews.Author: leemarie73
Reviews.Content: We did not know what to expect when we booked The Baldwin but were very surprised when we checked in. The room was small but very nicely kept, clean and had everything we needed. Our view was amazing. The bathroom was small but cute cute cute! It was not near the wharf but a short cab ride to the wharf. Walking distance through China Town and Union Square. The staff was friendly and accommodated us immediately when i requested extra blankets. All in all I would stay her again.. Nice, clean and very accomodateing.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel”
Reviews.Author: FG100
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel from other peoples reviews and it was even better than I had hoped for. The location can't be beat, it is minutes walk away from Union Square and all the shops. You can also walk to Fishermans Wharf, which is about a mile away, although with the hills a taxi is easier. The rooms are great, looked newly refurbished with a lovely bathroom, comfortable bed, tv. They are not huge rooms, but are big enough to feel comfy. The hotel is very quiet, again great considering its right in the city. The hotel does not have any facilities, but if you are just looking for a great comfortable base to explore the city it is perfect. There is internet in reception, which was fairly expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: FindingNickName
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a little old but well maintained. Most importantly, the room is clean. The washroom had bright white lights and yet no dirt could be seen. Great job. Location is just next to chinatown and easy access to union square. Parking along the road is available but subject to vacancies. Free from 9pm to 7am iirc. Internet is available for a fee. Great value for money if you are on a tighter budget.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay without car”
Reviews.Author: andanton
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel for city sightseeing trip. It's very well located, calm, affordable in price, the staff is very friendly and so on. I cannot say anything negative about this hotel. But its location in the very city center has one serious demerit: no space for parking. We arrived by car, and I returned this car to the Hertz office (which is just 5 minutes away) in the next morning. Ah, one more: internet is not free. I paid $23 for 3 days.

Reviews.Title: “Nice deal!”
Reviews.Author: sheynecris
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel... The rooms are clean; the staff is very helpful; the location is perfect (close to Union Square). Surprisingly cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Great central place to stay”
Reviews.Author: suzyqueen_10
Reviews.Content: Good value for money in this centrally located hotel. Staff very helpful, good housekeeping service with a nice, light and very tidy room (I was on Level 10). Only downside was that you had to pay for wireless (around $6-9 per day) - very unusual for San Fran! All in all a great place to stay and even with the wireless cost included it is a great economical option. I caught the BART into the city but arranged for a shuttle back to the airport through the hotel that cost around $15.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel in the heart of San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: harris39
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to do a last minute trip to San Francisco over Thanksgiving this year and wound up selecting the Baldwin hotel due to its great price and desirable location. Generally speaking we're the kind of travelers who use our hotel rooms for the bare necessities - sleeping and showering - so no frills rooms don't bother us so long is the price is good. We were really impressed with the Baldwin Hotel and would happily stay there again on future trips to San Francisco. It's really convenient to get to from the airport via public transportation as there is a BART station about four blocks away, and for the duration of our trip we were really happy to find that it was a quick walk to various bus and cable car lines that could whisk us away to other parts of the city. It was also just about 10 steps from the gate leading into China Town which was absolute heaven for us in terms of food options, and we were just 2 blocks north of Union Square which was great for doing some Black Friday shopping! Our room was definitely on the small side and luxuries were limited, but it was cozy and comfortable and we got good sleep even though the walls were quite thin (so we could on occasion hear our neighbors). I was disappointed that the television reception was pretty bad so that watching tv in the evenings was out (and only about 12 channels were available anyway), but that certainly wasn't a dealbreaker. Also, I always appreciate when Wifi or internet is available free somewhere in the hotel where I'm staying, but all internet was cost-based here. Thankfully there are a plethora of coffeeshops (and a Border) nearby where free Wifi was available so while that wasn't the most convenient alternative it was still something. The Baldwin Hotel certainly isn't the lap of luxury, but if you're looking for a frugal but comfortable place to stay while visiting San Francisco, it's a great choice. We really appreciated how the cleaning staff created sculptures out of our fresh towels each day (one day they made a crab, one day two kissing swans, etc.,) as it made our stay feel just a little more friendly and fun (and always made us laugh). Given the location, this hotel is a steal, and is a great choice if you want a prime home base while in town.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: AbdulHalim
Reviews.Content: Though the room size is rather small for 3 adults we have an enjoyable stay, will defnitely stay here again when visiting SF

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel less than 1 block from Chinatown.”
Reviews.Author: MrBurritoMan
Reviews.Content: A very charming well staffed hotel right at the foot of Chinatown. Very nice rooms with newer TVs and Windows. Charming working radiators in every room. Less than a block from several affordable and expensive restruants. Small market around the corner that has just about everything. This hotel is an incredible value.

Reviews.Title: “nice and clean”
Reviews.Author: Buddytam
Reviews.Content: The people are nice and helpful. Their heater is on for a fixed period. Once I told them I feel cold in the early morning, they ask if I need additional heater. Their services are also efficient and effective. The room is clean and have enough space for the price. Free coffee and tea at the lobby is warm. It located close to China Town and near Union Square and the train stations are very convenience to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value.”
Reviews.Author: ProfitRecovery
Reviews.Content: Very central location, walking distance to ChinaTown and Financial District. Hotel is clean and the staff are very friendly. Rates are very reasonable, so all in all, great value.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great value, decent room”
Reviews.Author: kbs-cc
Reviews.Content: Old building with noisy lights, questionable tv quality, and no free internet. However, it is a great location and a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Goo value, but too noise!”
Reviews.Author: McGyverBrasil
Reviews.Content: Great location, good value, clean, confortable. Realy cheaper for the location. But it is too noise because the street and the plumbing inside the room. It was dificulty to sleep well. Another thing that worth to comment: one guy tried to stole us right in front of the hotel! I know this is a safe area, but........ Good hotel to stay 2, or 3 nights at maximum. If you donÂ´t have problem with your budget maybe you would like to try another one.

Reviews.Title: “i loved it”
Reviews.Author: iloveminneapolis
Reviews.Content: its a great place with a perfect location - next to lots of stores and restaurants. I felt very safe in the area at night. I was attending a conference at the Marriott and it was less than a 10 minute walk. My room had also recently been re-done, so the bedding and tv were brand new. I will definitely stay here again. the room cleaning service was also really great. Only bummer? No free wi-fi! That definitely needs to br changed.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and acommodations for the price”
Reviews.Author: gwenlisa
Reviews.Content: My husband accompanied me to San Francisco for a 4-day business trip. We chose the Baldwin because it is centrally located and we read reviews that said it was clean/nice. The rooms are not the most up-to-date, but for the price ($60/night), our room was great. Also, there's so much to do in San Francisco that we hardly spent any waking hours at the hotel! The staff was nice and they allowed us to check in several hours early on the day of our arrival. If we weren't on a budget, we'd prefer to stay somewhere that has a gym and pool. Again, if you're looking for luxury or trendy, don't choose the Baldwin. If you want an excellent location, decent room, and a bargain, this might be the place.

Reviews.Title: “Great value hotel centrally located”
Reviews.Author: allischarming
Reviews.Content: This is a very well appointed and conveniently located hotel. My room was excellent and quiet considering the location. Easy for all downtown business and entertainment, great shopping just outside. Chinatown is right there, short walk to Moscone or the waterfront.

Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Forest4
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four from Australia who stayed for three nights in one room. Hotel was excellent value in a prime location near union square and Chinatown. Rooms not big, but clean and very comfortable. Staff friendly and helpful. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and hotel to explore San Francisco from.”
Reviews.Author: russonthejob
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic stay at the Baldwin, staff very helpful, hotel always clean and location was perfect. Checked out the hotel on Trip Advisor and thought it would be suitable for us. As it turned out it was better than expected in every way and all at an exellent price. Would recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: RealtorLady
Reviews.Content: Visited San Francisco for my birthday in November. Loved the linens and the room. Great location outside of the China Town gate. Small hotel with 8 - 10 rooms surrounding the elevator for 9 - 10 floors. Room sizes vary, with the rear corner rooms being the smallest. We chose the back of the hotel, because I had read that the garbagemen pick up the trash, in the early morning, in the front of hotel. Well, our friends in the front heard nothing, and we had trash pickup from the back of the hotel on Thursday night - my only complaint. Recommend a front (larger and quieter) room.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmglin
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights and loved it. The hotel is in a great location and close to Chinatown and Union Square. The staff are helpful and the rooms are big for SF standard. My room was very clean and it all looked new. All in all, a great stay and I will return again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our needs”
Reviews.Author: Meeshax
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the Baldwin at the beginning of November and we were very pleased by it. The rooms are basic - no artwork on the walls, no real view, on the small side - but they are spotlessly clean, excellent maid service. We also really liked the deep claw-foot bathtub and the big flat screen TV. The rooms are very quiet (as long as you leave the windows closed to keep the city noise out) and the beds are comfortable. The front counter staff were very pleasant and helpful. The location is also very good - central, right next to China Town gate and surrounded by many restaurants (sushi restaurant next door, Starbucks 2 doors down). This hotel is a true value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kiwibc
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin was great. Very central location, staff were helpful, rooms were very clean and spacious. Good value for money

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and location”
Reviews.Author: Carrot47
Reviews.Content: We were extremely happy with our 4 day stay. The location was excellent -near everything but without the crazy, over-crowded, noisy, busy area at Union Square. We were able to walk everywhere. The staff was so accommodating, polite and helpful. Our room (602) on the front of the building was actually roomy and was clean. There is some noise - like garbage trucks and sirens, but it IS a big city and that is normal. We openend our windows as the weather was almost perfect except for one rainy morning. But with the windows closed, it definately blocked out noise, too. The bed was pretty firm, but I slept fine. I was apprehensive about staying there since the rate (booked early and they had a promotion) was so reasonable and the other reviews mentioned things like the noise, musty hall ways, little rooms and old fashioned bath tub/shower. Yes, the hall did smell musty, but the room did not. I bought a rubber type bathmat (at the Dollar Store before we went) so that helped as far as it being slippery and difficult to get in the shower. The bathroom had been updated recently with new tile on the wall and floor. We had two seperate rooms and all four of us thought everything about the hotel was just great and would definately stay there again on any future trips to San Francisco!

Reviews.Title: “This was one of the cleanest hotels I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: toodlebug315
Reviews.Content: This is one great hotel! We had never been to San Francisco before and booked the Baldwin Hotel online. Was VERY pleased with it! Staff was very nice in helping us get around the area. Room made you feel like you were back in the 1930's, nothing special just regular hotel but it was one of the cleanest hotel rooms we had ever stayed at! And every day when we came back to the hotel there was an ORAGAMI animal placed on our bed made from a towel which was very special! We would recommend this hotel very highly! Was also close to chinatown, and cable cars, and since I have bad knees that was important!

Reviews.Title: “Safe for solo female traveler”
Reviews.Author: celphilviv
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night, joined a tour, and then returned to the hotel for five straight nights. I have no complaint about the rooms and both were clean with sufficient lighting. The first room faced the street but was right next to the elevator. The second was on a higher floor and quiet. I like the location as the hotel is right between Union Square and China town. It was pretty safe for a solo female traveller. It is almost like a four star hotel but without the perks (swimming pool, exercise room, restaurants, shops). Housekeeping was courteous and discreet. The only problem I encountered is having to wait for almost 20 minutes at the front counter for the person to finish eating his lunch (behind some door). I do miss the exercise room and will probably look for a hotel with one the next time I'm in San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable price and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: mauchi55
Reviews.Content: I stayed 3 nights in November. The room charge was so reasonable for the location. 30 seconds to China town and you can reach any place on foot. Many shops and restaurants are close to this hotel. So I think I will come back if I go San Francisco again on business.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, great location, a little noisy.”
Reviews.Author: snubian
Reviews.Content: Central location adjacent to Chinatown gate, a few blocks north of Market St and BART/MUNI stops. Many restaurants and bars close by. 24 hr reception, staff quick and friendly enough. I stayed here twice during my trip, the rooms were both reasonable size, the one at the front of the hotel slightly bigger but noisier. Street noise was an issue for me, lack of A/C means having the window open, which means more noise in the room. Also rooms adjacent to the elevators are noisy. Rooms on the alley side may be preferable. Bathroom was fine, enjoyed the bath. Bed was very comfortable for me, not too soft. Rooms clean if a little old fashioned, same goes for rest of hotel. Didn't use breakfast or coffee facilities. No fridge or microwave in room, not a problem for me. Rooms were well serviced. Price seems good for what is an excellent location for the average SF visitor. If you prefer a decent, clean, reasonably priced room in a central, safe location then this is a good choice for you. If you visit the sushi restaurant next door check out if there is a special for Baldwin guests.

Reviews.Title: “The price is right”
Reviews.Author: irisho_10
Reviews.Content: Great location near Union Square. Good hotel, no air conditioning. No fridge. No microwave.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was great, room was small but clean, location convenient”
Reviews.Author: noe96744
Reviews.Content: The hotel was conveniently located to shopping, buses, food, & cable car. The rooms were quite compact, not too much leg space once you get your luggage in the room - but we didn't spend too much time in the room. The clawed foot tub was a little wobbly but kind of quaint. The staff were very nice and knowledgeable with directions.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE - don't stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: athoms
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience at the Baldwin. We understand it's not the Bellagio but the customer service was disgraceful. Our room flooded with the insides of a faulty toilet after spending the night being woken up by a noisy piping system. We were moved to a smaller room where approximately 50% of the TV Channels didn't have reception. On departure we spoke to management who at first believed moving us to the cheaper room was sufficient compensation. After a 30 minute debate we were given a 20% discount. Given our experience we hardly thought that was good enough. The location is good but for the same price there are plenty of other places to stay in the same area. It was our first trip to San Francisco, pretty sad way to remember such a great city.

Reviews.Title: “Value & Location”
Reviews.Author: DingoD64
Reviews.Content: Service is fast & friendly. Rooms are old & not so large , but adequate. Free WiFi would be nice, but the location is what is the best about this hotel. Close to all the popular spots in downtown. The city can be noisy to someone who is not used to inner city living, so ask for a room towards the back of the building if required. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convient and good value”
Reviews.Author: PJKNorthernIreland
Reviews.Content: Eight of us had 4 rooms for 5 nights. All very clean and comfortable, rooms small but adequate. Very handy location in the city could not be better located. I would recommend this to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Safe, clean, friendly and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: DesertDweller10
Reviews.Content: It was everything we were looking for. A great location which was in a nice safe area. The room was clean and looked recently renovated. We had a room on the 8th floor towards the back so it was quiet. The staff were very helpful and it seemed to be a very popular hotel. Only thing it did not have that would have been nice is coffee making facilties in the room. There was always some on the go in the lobby though. There was a very convenient 7/11 around the corner and heaps of places to eat close by. Used the BART from the airport ($8.10 o.w) and walked up a few blocks from Powell St station. Loved the towel animals each day, very cute touch.

Reviews.Title: “better than i expected”
Reviews.Author: bugoff1229
Reviews.Content: after reading some reviews I was pleasantly surprised by my room. I am a middle aged girl solo traveler. my room was just around corner from elevator and on upper floor so my room was quiet, slept with windows open, room clean nice bedding and cute animal towels on bed. If you are a business hotel type though, this may not be for you but it was just fine for me. Small, clean, cozy.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jmbushnell
Reviews.Content: San Francisco is at the doorstep. Great value. Spacious double room. Comfortable bed. Nice bath. The desk and FAST wireless (at very minimal cost) worked great for getting in a couple hours of work. With our daughter living on Nob Hill this was the perfect room for us - spacious, comfortable but without costly (an unneeded) amenitites. Only detractions were that the hallways had an 'old building' odor and the coffee pot in the lobby tended to be empty.

Reviews.Title: “Would have been perfect with better customer service.”
Reviews.Author: stephb79
Reviews.Content: My husband and took our one vacation of the year to San Francisco and did a lot of research on where to stay. We picked the Baldwin Hotel for its location, good price and positive reviews. The hotel was perfect for us - great location, good sized room with a big closet, surprisingly quiet. It has less of a hotel feeling and more of feeling like a house (the doors have actual keys rather than cards!) and I really don't have any complaints at all about the hotel itself. But, we did have a disappointing experience with customer service that tainted our stay. We were in Vancouver before heading to SF, and the night before our flight my husband got a terrible case of food poisoning from our dinner. He was so sick there was no way we could travel the next day and we had to change our flight to the following day. So, instead of spending the 4 nights we at the Baldwin we had planned, we missed the first night and were there for 3 nights. I called them right away to let them know we would be a day late. It is their policy to charge you for the night unless you have a doctor's note as proof of illness -- which we of course didn't, since we were in Canada and my husband didn't need a doctor, he just needed to get through it and rest for a day. We explained the situation to them multiple times and they just wouldn't budge. Now of course I understand this is their policy, but it's always disappointing when a place of business won't be flexible in extreme circumstances -- it wasn't like we never showed up for our reservation, we got there as soon as we could and still stayed for 3 nights. And the night that we missed was a Monday night -- surely not a busy night where they would have lost money by not renting the room to someone else. It was just frustrating - it was hard to lose a day of our vacation and lose the extra money from having to pay for double hotel rooms that night on top of it. I find that most places of business in that kind of situation will be more understanding. After talking to several people, they finally offered us a complimentary night's stay through the end of this year, but wouldn't let us apply it to the night we missed - and we obviously aren't going back to SF this year, so it wasn't really worth anything. Oh well - it really is a good hotel for price and location and I liked the room - just not so much for above and beyond customer service. They were very penny pinching about the whole thing.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, very clean, friendly,safe, affordable”
Reviews.Author: MendozaEcoVerde
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin was a pleasant surprise: Not a luxury hotel, but it has all the characteristics I look for in a hotel: Safe and central location, very clean rooms, professional and friendly staff and affordable price.

Reviews.Title: “Good localization.”
Reviews.Author: JuCarreiro
Reviews.Content: Baldwin has a very good location. Near Union Square, easy to take the cable car and others public transport. The problens were: very small room, very noise, no air conditioner and only full size bed, that are small for a couple. The parking lot cost $28.50 per day and is far from the hotel. IThe internet access is fast but cost $8.95 per 24 hours. If you are not so exigent, it's a good choice

Reviews.Title: “Good deal: cheap, but small & noisy rooms.. Good for younger people on a budget!”
Reviews.Author: JLKane87
Reviews.Content: I would recommend this hotel if you are on a budget or have limited funding. The staff was absolutely great. They provided and accommodated for all of our needs. The rooms were small and every night around 3am, there was loud construction. That sums it up!

Reviews.Title: “If you are going to San Francisco be sure to stay at the Baldwin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kramcat
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable stay here. The rooms were clean we were two blocks away from Union Square and next to Chinatown. The staff in this hotel were very helpful and made us very welcome. Good for holiday and business. Do not get the shuttle bus to airport (10 dollars) better off in Taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel and good value for money. Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: The_Fosters_1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great central location, a nice safe area of San Francisco near the shops and pretty close to the chinese quarter. Although it is a fairly small hotel, the rooms are well appointed, very comfortable and lovely & clean. Don't be put off by the slightly odd smell in the reception area (just a bit old smelling), and the unfriendly manner of some (not all) of the staff, these two minor things aside we all thought it was a great hotel and was perfect for what we needed for our short stay in San Francisco. Would definitely consider stopping there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Nick1907
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Baldwin for 4 nights in September, having stayed at the hotel 3 years ago. As a result we knew what to expect, the hotel is in a great location, the rooms are clean and the staff are helpful and friendly. The first time we stayed we had a room at the front of the hotel which was a bit noisy (due to traffic etc outside), this time we had a room at the rear which was much quieter, although had no view. We would definitely stay again as the location is great and the hotel offers excellant value for money

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, safe neighbourhood, very clean rooms and friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: melbfamily10
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the first leg of our US trip. Don't but put off by the rather ordinary lobby, The Baldwin is more like a small English hotel - bathrooms are new and perfectly clean and well serviced (we have stayed in 5 star hotels that were not this clean), and you can open the windows! Excellent value for money (Avg $135USD per night). We booked two rooms - 1 double and 1 twin (for teenage children through Booking.Com). Our rooms, while small by US standards, had large walk in wardrobes for luggage storage. Hotel staff were very helpful - provided early morning checkin (after 15 hr flight from Australia) for $100USD, booked taxis for us, held luggage on last day and happily provided information when requested. Although no breakfast facility, there is a Starbucks on the the corner, and an excellent French cafe opposite. Easy walking to all amenities - Union Square, cable car, restaurants etc. Do make an effort to catch the Marrikesh Magic Show - fabulous for $26. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, convenient, inexpensive.”
Reviews.Author: Vumba
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin is my home away from home when I am in San Francisco. I have stayed here many times and will do so in the future. Great value for the price. Convenient and comfortable. Everything I need is within a short walk.

Reviews.Title: “Older but quite satisfactory for the money”
Reviews.Author: sam154980
Reviews.Content: Very courteous and helpful staff. Clean room. Great location for access to the transit and shopping with minimal street noise. Just make sure you don't get a room beside the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: leosip65
Reviews.Content: No other place where to stay in San Francisco for that price. The only problem was the wi=fi system didn't work with m Ipad but for that Starbucks is only 50 meters

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: S_Rost
Reviews.Content: Great location and friendly staff. Only drawback: noisy area (I sleept well, but my girlfriend had to use "ear plugs"). We would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Clean Hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: MSE1970
Reviews.Content: The location is the best point about this hotel, in the heart of downtown, a (small childs) stones throw from China town, about 15 minutes walk from the ferry terminal and well away from the tourist slum that is Fisherman's Wharf. Facilities are limited but the location means there are loads of eating & drinking options nearby, and a laundrette around the corner. I enjoyed my stay which was helped by the fact that SF is one of my favourite cities in the world.

Reviews.Title: “No frills, but cheap and clean”
Reviews.Author: waiwingtaialbert
Reviews.Content: Pros - Well located. Very easy to walk to all parts of town. Near to Chinatown as well. The people running this outfit are friendly, helpful and efficient. Rooms were clean. Good value for money. Cons - Small rooms (queen size beds only). For 2 persons with 3 or 4 suitcases (if shopping is the main aim of the trip), there is hardly space to walk. Internet costs 9 bucks a day. Loud street noise at night. They still use old fashioned keys, and it is sometimes difficult to open the doors. No valet parking. You have to park the car in a nearby garage (28 bucks a day), and walk back and forth yourself to collect the car.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem!”
Reviews.Author: travellingbrit99
Reviews.Content: Had a 5 night stay here. It's a really nice hotel, great location for shopping and good for a bit of sightseeing too. Staff were very helpful and friendly. Rooms were fairly small but spotlessly clean. The only bad thing about this hotel was the bedroom doors! It took us a while to get in ours at first as it was stiff and awkward, but ok after a bit, but when our new neighbours turned up at midnight and spent half an hour trying to open and then close there door it was not good! Definately recommend the hotel, just take some ear plugs in case your doors aren't good!

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, well located hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: NanBou
Reviews.Content: Stayed for five days in May in this hotel with a friend. Keeping in mind that this is a 2-star hotel, I believe that I've had my money worth. I would definately recommend this hotel. Positive - Very conveniently located: right next door to Chinatown, wihtin walking distance of the Montgomery BART station, close to Union Square. - Fairly priced - Very helpful and customer service oriented staff - Free in-room safe - Comfortable, good sized rooms Negative - The tidiness of our room left a little to be desired - The surroundings of the hotel can get noisy at night - WIFI is not free

Reviews.Title: “Very convinient and accommodating”
Reviews.Author: caloymd
Reviews.Content: Apart from enjoying Chinatown which is just few meters away from the Pagoda (gate), every deparment stores and fine dinnings are within walking distance. Rates are very reasonable for a place close to everything I wanted to be. Front dest are very helpfull and cordial. There are no frills but rooms are comfortable and a perfect place to relax your muscles after a day of walking. My best experience so far is when Ms. Viet Voung helped me to get 2 rooms on busy season and was able to give me a good discount as frequent guest.

Reviews.Title: “Will definintely return here!”
Reviews.Author: koens640
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough great things about the Baldwin. I have never written an online review before but really wanted others to know about this place. Budget and safety were top concerns for me when booking this trip -- I am a female graduate student, as is the friend I traveled with. I did thorough research on hotels in San Francisco and this was BY FAR the best price I came across, especially for this location (I honestly don't understand how they manage to keep their costs so low in such an expensive city; when we were there I passed by a hotel that I had previously seen online but decided not to go with because it was three times the price, it was located just down the block from the Baldwin but looked very much run down, while the Baldwin was very well maintained). We were a short walk from museums, shopping, restaurants and bars and felt comfortable taking the bus back from Haight later at night after going out over there (plenty of public transportation stops are on Market Street, just a few blocks away). The room was no frills but rather spacious, and VERY clean and quiet. The staff was WONDERFUL, always providing directions and recommendations on places to eat. They also had a $15 shuttle to the airport, which was definitely much cheaper than a cab. The only downside was that there wasn't a fridge in the room, and they didn't provide free internet, though there is a Starbucks just up the block with WiFi service. If you're looking for a super luxury hotel, this isn't the place for you. But if you're looking for a nice, spotless room at an incredibly reasonable rate in the heart of the city, you should definitely book this. This hotel is truly a steal, and I will definitely recommend it to friends and return there for my next trip to San Francisco.

Reviews.Title: “Solid all-around, great location”
Reviews.Author: dtandrews
Reviews.Content: Great price, room was clean, staff was very attentive, had no issues. Room wasn't big or lavish, but it had everything you'd need. Prime location, 30 minute walk to Fisherman's Wharf.

Reviews.Title: “Would Not Hesitate to Stay Here Again”
Reviews.Author: ochant
Reviews.Content: Rooms were basic, but very clean. With all that there is to do in San Francisco, who wants to spend a whole lot of time in their room anyway? We just wanted a place that was clean, safe, and had a helpful staff. I would say the Baldwin met all three requirements. The Baldwin is literally just steps away from the China Town gate so there is a lot of foot and vehicle traffic in front of it. We had a room on the 5th floor facing the street and slept with the window open every night and didn't really think it was all the noisy. No bar or restaurant in the actual hotel itself, but you have a Starbucks and Sushi place right next door and a French restaurant and a wine and coffee bar directly across the street. Wireless internet goes for about $9 per day, $18 for 3 days and somewhere around $35 for a month. Still cheaper to pay for the internet here than pay up to $100 more a night just to stay at the higher end hotels in the same area. Public trans, trolly and subway were also very close to this location. AT&T Park is only around 1.5 miles away so I didn't see the need to flag a cab to get there...I walked it just fine. Bottom line, The Baldwin Hotel isn't a five star hotel and doesn't claim to be. It was still a nice hotel centrally located to China Town, Union Square (where the shopping is) and the Financial district. Beds could be a little more comfortable, but they weren't bad. With a very friendly staff, clean and safe location, I don't think we could have found a better place to stay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “A good option for hotel in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: cpbdn
Reviews.Content: Very good location, just outside of China Town and it's really easy to move from there to almost everywhere. The rooms are clean and big enough, except the ones adapted for wheelchairs. I got one of these and because the bathroom has to be adapted and need more space, the space dedicated to the bedroom results tiny for two people, even if they sell it as double bedroom. Also, because is adapted it does not have a bath or shower plate, but the water goes directly to the floor. I would have really appreciated the hotel asking me before giving me an adapted room. My friends got a normal room which was roomy and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for the money paid”
Reviews.Author: anttraveller85
Reviews.Content: Location of this hotel is excellent. For the money this is the best value.

Reviews.Title: “Great budget hotel, well located and clean - staff helpful”
Reviews.Author: Drlarinlou
Reviews.Content: Great value , not fancy but very functional with a very helpful staff Comfortable bed , flat screen tv

Reviews.Title: “Excellent budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: yael_l
Reviews.Content: This is a perfect spot for the budget traveler. The hotel is inexpensive, wonderfully located and well furnished. There's coffee/tea and vending machines downstairs. The rooms were clean and sufficient. The receptionists were always kind and helpful. The housekeeping service is excellent - whenever you get back to your room you'll have a towel-animal waiting for you on the bed (each time a different animal). What a nice touch! Just take into consideration that internet access is not free and that some of the tv channels had terrible feedback noise that makes it impossible to watch (but we don't really go on vacation to watch tv do we?). The hotel is recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Lee_g15
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Baldwin Hotel for 2 nights. Good - great location (so close to chinatown & union square), comfortable bed, decent size rooms (we were there only to sleep), renovated bathroom, decent price Bad - very noisy from the garbage truck pick up from outside (for the 2 nights we were there), the heater was making weird noises - it was an old gas oil heater, the room is quite old except for the renovated toilet Tip: * Just in case you check in late, the front door shuts at 9pm but there is someone there

Reviews.Title: “Good value, great location”
Reviews.Author: michitrav
Reviews.Content: The Civic Center neighborhood is a great location for tourists. Lots of other hotels around, & located right outside the ChinaTown gate. Lots of good stores & restaurants, safe comfortable wandering around; good access to buses. Baldwin has limited service; only one desk person in lobby. You will park your own car, hump your own bags. Small room (expected in older city hotel), very clean. We were four adults (our two adult kids with us). Only one chair in room, so you will read in bed if there is more in your party and it's not easy to read in bed with only one pillow!! Load us up with pillows & good quality bedding!!! Time for an upgrade there. We do prefer smaller more personal hotels, which this is, & would not want to stay in a big-box Hilton or others similar, although I know they are very nice.

Reviews.Title: “safe and perfect location to visit san francisco attractions”
Reviews.Author: sumandatta
Reviews.Content: we stayed for 2 nights and it was a great experience. Rooms were good and service was nice. Best thing was the location. Very near Chinatown and Union Square and easily accessible through bus service to fisherman's wharf and golden gate etc. (Bus route 30). Ideal for tourists who want a budget stay in a safe neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Barsuchok
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at one of the cheapest rates available in the city and for this money the hotel ticked all the boxes, except one - we were not lucky and got the room by the elevator shaft, so it was really noisy, but otherwise - Baldwin is in the perfect safe location at China town gates and 5 minutes walk to Union Square, the rooms were spacious and nicely decorated, the bathroom was clean with nice set of shampoos etc, the service was very helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “great experience”
Reviews.Author: juliejulie33
Reviews.Content: great position, very friendly and helpful staff, reasonable price (w/o free internet nor breakfast), great for city tour

Reviews.Title: “poor service, not worth it”
Reviews.Author: Raphel97
Reviews.Content: no free internet, no refrigrator in room. poor service, not worth the money. Although the loacation is good. But you have to spend more on other stuff, such as internet and breakfast. I would rather choose some other hotels with better service.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinSueWashingto
Reviews.Content: We found the Baldwin to be a lovely hotel in a great location. Safe area just outside the gate to Chinatown and a short walk to Union Square. We stayed here for our 10-year-anniversary and were more than pleased. Front desk is courteous and welcoming. Security of front door and desk in evening hours to be appreciated. Rooms are clean and well-kept, though sparsley decorated which didn't matter to us, and the renovated bathrooms are spacious and charming. The hotel does not have a restuarant or lounge, but we did not find this to be a problem. Within very short walking distance is Starbucks, located less than a minute away a, fancy cafe just across and a little up the street, and a wine bar directely across. The Warf and Pier 39 are a bit away, but easy to get to by cable car which is inexpensive and easy to use. The ferry bulding is an easy 15/20 minute walk. I would stay at the Baldwin again and recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “nice place close to china town”
Reviews.Author: sebsahib
Reviews.Content: very nice place to stay, easy, comfortable, all you need, not too fancy. Hotel is directly at lions gate and close to china town. ten minutes walk and you reach the italian quarter. Rooms were clean and even though our room faced the street it wasnÂ´t loud at all. Sturbucks is next door. Some facilities downstairs in the hotel such as water, coffee, tea.

Reviews.Title: “Just right! Best location, best price.”
Reviews.Author: grace06529
Reviews.Content: Nice clean room and tastefuly furnished in the 5th floor. The problem with the elevator is not so bad. It just stops in the 4th floor whether you like it or not. Just be patient. After 30 seconds it will continue in its trip up or down.

Reviews.Title: “Best money can get!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kenny13
Reviews.Content: Staying in Baldwin right now, till 22 Jun. It's a nice hotel for $80ies/ night on weekdays. The room is just renovated, clean, comfy. Bathroom is super clean too. Though I was hesitate to book at first since the rate is so low. But it's actually very nice hotel, covers more than basic needs of sleep n shower. Great location!!! Close to public transport too. There's also a Wallgreen 24/ 7 store two blocks away on Powell St. This hotel is a perfect choice for fellow TAs who are looking for affordable and above average hotel in SF.

Reviews.Title: “great location! nice place!”
Reviews.Author: VictoriaGlenview
Reviews.Content: great great location. very nice place to stay in downtown. very close to "china town" about 10 seconds of walking :)

Reviews.Title: “Great location - get a room away from the lifts!”
Reviews.Author: ShanePPP
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just 2 minutes walk from Union Square so it's a great location for shopping, dining and within easy reach of all public transport. There's also a cool wine bar opposite the hotel with a fabulous wine list. The rooms aren't huge and the bathtub was really just a place to stand while showering. However our room was fine as a place to drop the bags and head out sightseeing. One problem - elevator noise - make sure you insist on a room away from the noisy elevators!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't beat the price for the room or location”
Reviews.Author: lingit
Reviews.Content: Two blocks from the Montgomery train station and within walking distance of everything,including Giants stadium. Front desk was nice and gave pointers on everything we asked. The most comfortable bed I've slept on in a while and that surprised my roomate and I. Breakfast,shopping,bars,Chinatown, all within walking. I booked a couple months in advance so the price was great. I checked rates closer to the check-in date(memorial day wknd) and would have paid more if I didn't book so far out. Had a room overlooking the alley so noise was no problem. Small room but plenty for 2 people. Bathroom updated and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Baldwin Hotel - Great Value, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: luvtotravelAtlanta
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal with the Baldwin Hotel on Priceline. It was in such a perfect location for tourists. A few feet (literally) from the Chinatown Gate, a few blocks from all transportation, right in the midst of Union Square shopping, one block from the Grand Hyatt where we had drinks on the 36th floor and enjoyed the awesome view of the city, two blocks from Sears Fine Foods for breakfast, etc, etc. Could not have been in a better location for tourism. We walked to the Ferry Building one morning and walked back from Fishermans Wharf one afternoon (about 30 minute walk). The staff was so pleasant and helpful with recommendations and they even watched our bags while we did last minute touring. The room was basic, somewhat small but comfortable and clean. View was of the street below where all the shopping was. Very pleased with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location and friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: Mobeth10
Reviews.Content: The staff of the hotel is very friendly. The location is very good, walking distance to cafes, commercial center, public transportation and tour bus. The room was spacious enough and quiet, even though it was in a busy street. The region is ok to walk at night.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at Baldwin hotel”
Reviews.Author: AliciaValeria
Reviews.Content: Hi, we realy enjoyed being in the Hotel, the rooms are clean , we were friendly treated, and the balance between fares and services were good. We trully recommend Baldwin Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good value, don't expect everything, but you wont pay for too much.”
Reviews.Author: ihearttraveldeals
Reviews.Content: GREAT location for the price. Close to shopping and fun night life. Not a quiet or luxurious hotel, but it has almost anything you would need. I have stayed here twice and the staff has been very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - good value with adequate comfort - helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: Alamo77
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel within sight of the Chinatown Gate & is in a very good location for walking and virtually all public transport routes including SFO main airport. An old established hotel with heating system that is a little antiquated - can't turn off - but all in all this hotel was very good value - economy prevails when folk wish to tour & enjoy without watching the dollars & dimes too much. Helpful staff able to provide good advice on transport & an excellent Chinese restaurant in Chinatown.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...”
Reviews.Author: sillythetourist
Reviews.Content: I loved San Fran, and this hotel was a pretty great find, comfortable rooms, and amazing location... There were minor things that were annoying e.g. the shower rod holding together the shower was broken, and the cleaning lady walking in as i was asleep at 9 am, these things were only a small annoyance, but i still would recommend this hotel, really friendly staff, and they were very accommodating to hold our luggage when we had a late flight, a great price too, the only thing that was a bit of a pain was the wi-fi was not free, and every hotel i have stayed in in the usa has had internet included free, but still would highly recommend hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to enjoy SF without breaking the bank”
Reviews.Author: berm57
Reviews.Content: I was really pleased with this hotel. The staff was very friendly and polite. I don't know why anyone would think different. One of them even helped me to use the coke machine. Really nice people. The room was in immaculate condition with an old time feel to it but like new appearance. There is a large safe in the closet that so big I could put my laptop in it when I left the room. The elevator has a small door but it is big inside, I guess due to the time period of the building. All in all I was very satisfied and I recommend the Baldwin to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Value, Great Location, Great Service”
Reviews.Author: tmy62070
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin was a quaint little hotel that provides great value. They have updated the rooms but left some of its historic character. The staff and service were always effienent and friendly. It's location is right outside the gate to China Town and is close to many locations within the financial district. There are plenty of shopping and dining opportunities within a few blocks of the front door. When visiting SF on business or leisure I will be sure to look up The Baldwin.

Reviews.Title: “Really a good value”
Reviews.Author: Kansastraveller1
Reviews.Content: This is a fine place to stay if you are looking for a low price place without a lot of bells and whistles. I liked it quite a bit. The front desk help was excellent. The rooms were small, about normal size. My room was very dated--and quaint--but it was absolutely spotless and clean. The hall smelled a little musty, but the room was fine. The location is right in the middle of the action in near Union Square and about a block from the Chinatown gate. All in all, i don't think you'll find a better value in the low end market. This is not a fancy place.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: soday1612
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very comfortable. It doesn't have a lot of amenities but it was clean and the staff was friendly and helpful. It's conveniently located too tourist attractions, dinning and shopping. The price was reasonable and I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again!”
Reviews.Author: charl_lou
Reviews.Content: Staff very helpful and friendly. Excellent location - next to China Town gate and 2 blocks from Union Square and Macy's. Very good for the price - at least 30% cheaper than other hotels in the area!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable charming room, great location, wonderful staff.”
Reviews.Author: LinTurtle
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Baldwin Hotel in San Francisco for three nights this past week, and thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I loved the charming corner room. It was very clean, comfortable and roomy, and it was fun to look at the views of the streets from the windows. The location was perfect for my visit as I was able to walk different directions each morning and find something new to experience in San Francisco. It is just a few steps from the beginning of Chinatown, and I felt very safe walking in the blocks close to the hotel. The staff was very pleasant, courteous and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Satisfied customer”
Reviews.Author: solotravel2010
Reviews.Content: This was the second time I have stayed here. I have found the room to be clean, staff is friendly and location is great . It is close to public transportation and Union Square. I would not hesitant to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “no frills accommodation in central location”
Reviews.Author: Sue186346
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located, which has some pluses but more minuses for me - it was noisy at night, with garbage van collections in the middle of the night as well as the usual traffic noise. The room was adequate but definitely no frills - but the bed was comfortable. Unfortunately someone in the neighbouring room left at 4 am every day I was there (5 days) and because of the noise of leaving - two keys are required to open and unlock the room doors, I was woken up every time. There are very limited facilities in this hotel, I wanted a spoon to eat a yogurt but they were unable to provide one. There is basically just coffee and tea downstairs in the lobby. There is a good cafe just across the road which is open early for breakfast. The staff were quite helpful especially when I was left stranded after the volcano issue prevented me leaving as planned, but they are basically there to deal with reservations and enquiries and seem to have little to do with the running of the place. The hair dryer in the room did not work, and most channels on the tv had so much interference that it was impossible to view them. Definitely a budget level hotel -

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mgladding
Reviews.Content: I was in San Francisco for a conference and chose the Baldwin because of the location and the price. It's only a 3 minute walk from the Montgomery BART station and really close to Market Street and Chinatown. The room was small, but comfortable. Even thought my room faced the street, the room was very quiet when the windows were closed. The hotel doesn't have many amenities, but who cares? No one goes to San Francisco to hang out in their hotel room! If you're looking for a clean, inexpensive, safe place to stay for vacation or for business, I'd recommend the Baldwin. I'd stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect hotel if you suffer from hearing loss”
Reviews.Author: OshawatlcRN
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a fabulous location and staff are friendly ; HOWEVER, there is one caveat and that is if you are booked in a room facing Grant Street the noise at night is unending due to the large alley directly across the street with at least 12 industrial garbage bins that are emptied at all hours of the night. Also the rooms ending in 01 are abutting the old elevator and it clunks and bangs all night.It was a great stay in San Francisco if you don't mind the lack of sleep at night!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: TheSwissFamilyF
Reviews.Content: Just got back from an 8 day stay at the Baldwin. Was supposed to be only 3 days but we got caught up in the flight cancellations back to Europe due to the volcano and had to book extra 5 nights. The staff were extremely helpful and sympathetic about our situation. The hotel itself is small and fairly old fashioned but it's location was excellent and the rooms comfortable and quiet (apart from the dumpster trucks which seem to operate all night long). We would certainly stay here again if we return to S.F

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at San Francisco”
Reviews.Author: Meli-Eze
Reviews.Content: booked the hotel at really good, price, thought the place wouldnt be as nice as it seems in the pictures but it excedeed my expectations, super clean & big room & bathroom. Amazing location, close to all shopping venues and near all transportation (BART, cable car & Muni Buses). I fully recomend the hotel; the only thing, try to ask for a room far from the elevator because itÂ´s noisy, and a floor high up, because the view is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: SoBenj
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed staying at this hotel. Staff was pleasant and location was amazing (only 5 minutes walking from Union Square and so close from Chinatown !). The streets can be a bit noisy but this is not due to the hotel !

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: Pisoa
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights and really liked the place : It is perfectly-well located in SF to enjoy the city. The room was on the 9th floor, quiet and bright. Add to that, the cleaning was done every day so our room was spick and span. A hotel I would advise to solo traveller too, as it is affordable and well located to reach by night.

Reviews.Title: “I enjoyed my stay.”
Reviews.Author: captainmidwest
Reviews.Content: The hotel was close to China Town and a few blocks from the BART.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great service, I would be willing to bet the best value near Union Square”
Reviews.Author: jazimm2
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and 2 other couples went there for vacation last week. It was a wonderful experience. The staff was exceptionally curteous and the value was amazing! I had never been to San Fran and it was perfectly located near chinatown, which was great, and less than 2 blocks to trolley, cable cars, buses and 3-4 blocks from the F-line train. I will say that I thought the beds could have been a little more comfortable, but I said that about the Hyatt Regency I stayed at the week before in Boston so...whatever! It's an older hotel, but the character. location and service make it a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “small room, but clean and great location”
Reviews.Author: tryingtobehappy
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in that location (right outside Chinatown) and you are not going to spend much time in the room, this is a very good place. My room was very small, and had very little entertainment, but it had the necessaries (an iron, a hairdryer (hidden in an unlikely place, the drawer behind the tv), a TV with very few channels, but I still caught an interesting movie); an electric kettle would make it idea. My room (a single) had no hallway, you enter from the hotel hallway right in your room, and from the room right into the bathroom and the closet, but everything you need is there. Nothing I would want to spend much time in, but I had a very good night's sleep. It was kind of hard to keep the curtains open, as the next building was very close, but the curtains were very thick.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly nice hotel, inexpensive near the good part of Union Square.”
Reviews.Content: I don't know why this hotel is inexpensive, but I'm not about to complain. The rooms were very clean, the bathrooms had a very new look to them and the staff was very accomodating. We got (slightly) late check-out but they held our luggage for us all day while we walked around town. The only negatives...a very nice TV that has interference or a weak signal. And the wifi was not free.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: TravelerJDFontana_CA
Reviews.Content: No frills, but you can't beat the rate and location. Nearby hotels charge at least two times as much for the nightly rates. The Baldwin is conveniently located near China Town, Union Square, Financial District, and BART all of which are within reasonable walking distances. Outside noise could be a factor , but could be lessen with the windows closed.

Reviews.Title: “The Baldwin offers excellent value in a fine location.”
Reviews.Author: Viagger
Reviews.Content: The Baldwin is a great hotel for anyone who cares little about elegance, but values being in a clean, well-run hotel in an excellent location with helpful staff and very reasonable rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Very Clean, But A Bit Small and Old!”
Reviews.Author: Ujio7
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel with perfect location, you cannot be wrong about this when booking the Baldwin. The rooms are so clean that you definitely feel cozy there. The room was a bit small and furniture a little old, but as a group of friends traveling, it was the best bang for our buck. I highly recommend for groups of 3 or 4 to stay downtown and enjoy SF for a few days.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: nenaqu
Reviews.Content: this place has everything a traveler to san francisco would require. incredible location. it was easy to travel to and from the hotel. the room was clean and spacious. the front desk was friendly and efficient.

Reviews.Title: “All you could ask for- marvellous staff, lovely rooms, and central to everything!”
Reviews.Author: Cazpar26
Reviews.Content: Staff so helpful and welcoming- I phoned and the staff member helped me with shuttle and then welcomed me so nicely at the hotel.
